intro: Tribulopis marliesiae, commonly known as the Marlies' tribulus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and spiny fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, compound leaves and produces capsules that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
